Free Resources

Finding help shouldn't be hard. Helping others should be simple. Everything you need to get support or give back in Philadelphia.

Food Help (Start Here)

The most direct and immediate resources for finding free meals and groceries in Philadelphia.

  • City of Philadelphia — Find Free Food
  • PA 211 Food Resources
  • Philabundance (Find Food)
  • Share Food Program
  • Healthy Minds Philly — Hunger Resources

SNAP / EBT (Food Stamps)

Long-term nutritional assistance programs for low-income individuals and families.

  • PA SNAP Info (Official)
  • COMPASS (Manage Benefits)
  • BenePhilly (Free Help Applying)

WIC (Women, Infants, Children)

Supplemental nutrition, healthcare referrals, and nutrition education for mothers and children.

  • USDA WIC — Pennsylvania Contact

Emergency Assistance

Federal emergency food assistance program for those in immediate crisis.

  • USDA TEFAP Program

Pantry Locator Tools

Digital tools to find the closest food pantries operating in your zip code.

  • Plentiful Pantry Finder

Essential Guides

Download and print these resources for offline use.

Free PDF Downloads

Philly Food Help Pack

Our comprehensive starter pack for families.

7-Day Meal Plan

Simple, affordable meals for families of four.

SNAP/WIC Checklist

Everything you need to apply for benefits.

Emergency Grocery List

Vital items to have in your pantry.

Lead Magnet

Get the Philly Food Help Pack (Free PDF)

A printable guide with food resources, steps to get support, and ways to take action — made for Philadelphia families and supporters.

  • Direct links to 20+ Philadelphia food sites
  • Step-by-step SNAP/WIC application guide
  • Printable emergency grocery checklists
  • Volunteer quick-start information

Optional. No spam, only hope.
